What is the purpose of the `OPTION_PBAAS` flag in a PBaaS chain definition?
The `OPTION_PBAAS` flag, which has a decimal value of 256, indicates that a specific definition is for a PBaaS (Private Blockchain as a Service) chain.

OPTION_PBAAS = 0x100          // (256 decimal) this is a PBaaS chain definition
                     OPTION_GATEWAY_CONVERTER = 0x200    // (512 decimal) this means that for a specific PBaaS gateway, this is the default converter and will publish prices
                     OPTION_GATEWAY_NAMECONTROLLER = 0x400 // (1024 decimal) when not set on a gateway, top level ID and currency registration happen on launch chain
                     OPTION_NFT_TOKEN = 0x800        // (2048 decimal) single satoshi NFT token, tokenizes control over the root ID
                     OPTION_NO_IDS = 0x1000         // (4096 decimal) this currency cannot issue IDs
										        OPTIONS_FLAG_MASK = 0xfff
 "name" : "xxxx",         (string, required) name of existing identity with no active or pending blockchain
 "idregistrationfees" : "xx.xx", (value, required) price of an identity in native currency
 "idreferrallevels" : n,     (int, required) how many levels ID referrals go back in reward
 "notaries" : "[identity,..]",  (list, optional) list of identities that are assigned as chain notaries
 "minnotariesconfirm" : n,    (int, optional) unique notary signatures required to confirm an auto-notarization
 "notarizationreward" : "xx.xx", (value, required) default VRSC notarization reward total for first billing period
 "proofprotocol" : n,       (int, optional) if 2, currency can be minted by whoever controls the ID
                         1 = PROOF_PBAASMMR - Verus MMR proof, no notaries required
                         2 = PROOF_CHAINID - non-native only - currency has centralized control, and
./raw_text_input_wiki/clifaq-02_verus_commands.md
What is the significance of the `OPTION_GATEWAY_CONVERTER` flag in a PBaaS gateway definition?
The `OPTION_GATEWAY_CONVERTER` flag, which has a decimal value of 512, indicates that for a specific PBaaS gateway, this is the default converter and will publish prices.

What is the purpose of the `OPTION_NFT_TOKEN` flag in a token definition?
The `OPTION_NFT_TOKEN` flag, which has a decimal value of 2048, indicates that a token is a single satoshi NFT token, which tokenizes control over the root ID.

OPTION_PBAAS = 0x100          // (256 decimal) this is a PBaaS chain definition
                     OPTION_GATEWAY_CONVERTER = 0x200    // (512 decimal) this means that for a specific PBaaS gateway, this is the default converter and will publish prices
                     OPTION_GATEWAY_NAMECONTROLLER = 0x400 // (1024 decimal) when not set on a gateway, top level ID and currency registration happen on launch chain
                     OPTION_NFT_TOKEN = 0x800        // (2048 decimal) single satoshi NFT token, tokenizes control over the root ID
                     OPTION_NO_IDS = 0x1000         // (4096 decimal) this currency cannot issue IDs
										        OPTIONS_FLAG_MASK = 0xfff

What does it mean if a currency has the `OPTION_NO_IDS` flag set?
If a currency has the `OPTION_NO_IDS` flag set, which has a decimal value of 4096, it means that this currency cannot issue IDs.

OPTION_PBAAS = 0x100          // (256 decimal) this is a PBaaS chain definition
                     OPTION_GATEWAY_CONVERTER = 0x200    // (512 decimal) this means that for a specific PBaaS gateway, this is the default converter and will publish prices
                     OPTION_GATEWAY_NAMECONTROLLER = 0x400 // (1024 decimal) when not set on a gateway, top level ID and currency registration happen on launch chain
                     OPTION_NFT_TOKEN = 0x800        // (2048 decimal) single satoshi NFT token, tokenizes control over the root ID
                     OPTION_NO_IDS = 0x1000         // (4096 decimal) this currency cannot issue IDs
										        OPTIONS_FLAG_MASK = 0xfff

What is the purpose of the `proofprotocol` property in a currency definition?

The `proofprotocol` property in a currency definition specifies the proof protocol used by the currency. For example, if set to 1, it uses the Verus MMR proof, which does not require notaries. If set to 2, it uses the PROOF_CHAINID proof, which means that the currency has centralized control and can be minted by whoever controls the ID.

OPTION_PBAAS = 0x100          // (256 decimal) this is a PBaaS chain definition
                     OPTION_GATEWAY_CONVERTER = 0x200    // (512 decimal) this means that for a specific PBaaS gateway, this is the default converter and will publish prices
                     OPTION_GATEWAY_NAMECONTROLLER = 0x400 // (1024 decimal) when not set on a gateway, top level ID and currency registration happen on launch chain
                     OPTION_NFT_TOKEN = 0x800        // (2048 decimal) single satoshi NFT token, tokenizes control over the root ID
                     OPTION_NO_IDS = 0x1000         // (4096 decimal) this currency cannot issue IDs
										        OPTIONS_FLAG_MASK = 0xfff

What is the significance of the `notaries` property in a currency definition?
The `notaries` property in a currency definition specifies a list of identities that are assigned as chain notaries. These notaries are responsible for confirming transactions on the chain.

OPTION_PBAAS = 0x100          // (256 decimal) this is a PBaaS chain definition

                     OPTION_NO_IDS = 0x1000         // (4096 decimal) this currency cannot issue IDs
